item.title: Trump’s Greenland fixation curdles into a crisis
item.description: Could the president really be so reckless that he would risk undoing America’s strongest alliance?

item.title: Trump seizes a tanker and loses patience with Putin
item.description: The Russian president lying to him about his home being attacked was an own goal.

item.title: The woman fatally shot by ICE in Minneapolis did not deserve to die
item.description: Rioting in response to fatal shooting plays into Trump’s hands.

item.title: How the internet changed politics — and our lives — forever
item.description: Matthew Yglesias has been a disrupter his entire career. He started as an early adapter to the web, running a blog before blogs were a thing. He went on to co-found the media company Vox and has written all over the internet. He joins host Megan McArdle to discuss their career trajectories and how the internet has changed both media and politics.

item.title: The world has a few more years
item.description: As AI becomes part of everyday life, predictions about it are mellowing.

item.description: The Trump administration has leverage to release victims of the regime’s repression.

item.title: Trump may regret bypassing Congress on Venezuela
item.description: If the United States gets dragged in to a longer conflict, the absence of authorization will matter.

item.title: Good riddance, Corporation for Public Broadcasting
item.description: The unfunded and unneeded organization has correctly chosen to disband.

item.title: Trump might have his hubris checked in Venezuela
item.description: The president has launched a violent process of change that he can’t fully control.
